heading: fat lady warms up
subheading: it's beginning to look a lot like christmas ... for dubya, anyway. the florida supreme court ruled tuesday that 25,000 absentee ballots challenged by the democrats in two counties should be counted -- even though they had been fiddled with by republican activists. had the ballots been invalidated, al gore would have overtaken george w. bush for florida's popular vote. the u.s. supremes still have to rule on partial manual recounts, but dubya's probably high-tailin' it into amarillo to rent a tux, right about now.
author: wired staff
text: it's beginning to look a lot like christmas ... for dubya, anyway. the florida supreme court ruled tuesday that 25,000 absentee ballots challenged by the democrats in two counties should be counted -- even though they had been fiddled with by republican activists. had the ballots been invalidated, al gore would have overtaken george w. bush for florida's popular vote. the u.s. supremes still have to rule on partial manual recounts, but dubya's probably high-tailin' it into amarillo to rent a tux, right about now.
